text: The MMR vaccine does not cause autism.
The fraudulent Wakefield study was retracted.
Andrew Wakefield lost his medical license.
Vaccine safety is continuously monitored.
VAERS collects vaccine adverse event reports.
Most vaccine side effects are mild and temporary.
Severe vaccine reactions are extremely rare.
Vaccines have saved millions of lives.
Childhood vaccines protect against 14 diseases.
HPV vaccines prevent cervical cancer.
Hepatitis B vaccine was the first anti-cancer vaccine.
Shingles vaccine prevents painful outbreaks.
Tetanus boosters are needed every 10 years.
Rabies is nearly always fatal without vaccination.
Rabies vaccine can work after exposure.
Yellow fever vaccine provides lifelong immunity.
Typhoid vaccine is recommended for travelers.
Japanese encephalitis vaccine protects travelers.
Malaria vaccine was approved in 2021.
RTS,S is the first malaria vaccine.
Malaria kills over 600,000 people yearly.
Most malaria deaths are children under 5.
Plasmodium parasites cause malaria.
Female Anopheles mosquitoes spread malaria.
Bed nets prevent malaria transmission.
DDT was once used to control malaria.
Artemisinin is the most effective malaria treatment.
Tu Youyou won the Nobel Prize for artemisinin.
Sickle cell trait provides malaria resistance.
G6PD deficiency also protects against malaria.
Dengue fever is spread by Aedes mosquitoes.
Dengue can cause severe hemorrhagic fever.
Zika virus causes birth defects.
Zika can spread through sexual contact.
Chikungunya causes severe joint pain.
West Nile virus spread to the Americas in 1999.
Most West Nile infections are asymptomatic.
Genetically modified mosquitoes could control disease.
Gene drives could eliminate malaria mosquitoes.
Wolbachia bacteria can reduce mosquito-borne disease.
Sterile insect technique releases infertile males.
Oxitec mosquitoes carry a lethal gene.
Mosquito control has ethical considerations.
Mosquitoes are important pollinators in some ecosystems.
Only female mosquitoes bite.
Mosquitoes detect CO2 from 150 feet away.
Some people attract mosquitoes more than others.
Blood type O may attract more mosquitoes.
Drinking beer increases mosquito attraction.
Pregnant women attract twice as many mosquitoes.
DEET is the most effective mosquito repellent.
Picaridin is as effective as DEET.
Oil of lemon eucalyptus is a natural repellent.
Citronella has limited effectiveness.
Bug zappers don't significantly reduce mosquitoes.
Bats can eat 1,000 mosquitoes per hour.
Dragonflies are voracious mosquito predators.
Gambusia fish eat mosquito larvae.
Purple martins don't actually eat many mosquitoes.
Larval control is more effective than adult control.
Standing water breeds mosquitoes.
Mosquitoes can breed in a bottle cap of water.
Mosquitoes have been around for 100 million years.
There are over 3,500 mosquito species.
Most mosquito species don't bite humans.
Mosquito saliva contains anticoagulants.
Itching is an allergic reaction to mosquito saliva.
Some people develop tolerance to mosquito bites.
Mosquitoes are the deadliest animals on Earth.
Mosquitoes kill over 700,000 people annually.
Ticks can transmit Lyme disease.
Lyme disease is the most common tick-borne illness.
A tick must be attached 36-48 hours to transmit Lyme.
The bullseye rash is characteristic of Lyme.
Lyme disease can cause chronic symptoms.
Tick populations are increasing with climate change.
Lone star ticks can cause meat allergy.
Alpha-gal syndrome causes reactions to red meat.
Rocky Mountain spotted fever can be fatal.
Ehrlichiosis is a tick-borne bacterial infection.
Babesiosis is a tick-borne parasitic infection.
Tick paralysis is caused by tick saliva.
Ticks can survive freezing temperatures.
Deer ticks are responsible for most Lyme transmission.
Mice are the main reservoir for Lyme bacteria.
Opossums eat ticks and reduce Lyme risk.
Guinea fowl are excellent tick predators.
Permethrin-treated clothing repels ticks.
Daily tick checks prevent disease transmission.
Fine-tipped tweezers are best for tick removal.
Don't twist or squeeze when removing ticks.
Save removed ticks for identification.
A Lyme vaccine for humans existed briefly.
Dogs can be vaccinated against Lyme.
New Lyme vaccines are in development.
Fleas spread bubonic plague.
The Black Death killed 1/3 of Europe.
Yersinia pestis bacteria cause plague.
Plague still exists in parts of the world.
Antibiotics can treat plague if caught early.
